title: Row Finder Depth Expansion
summary: Row generation must expand into under-covered tools and asymmetric pairs to preserve inevitable decisions.
what_this_is: Defines the expansion rule for producing high-quality rows once obvious comparisons are exhausted.
structural_problem: Without enforced expansion, Row Finder repeats dominant tools and overlapping logic, reducing viable rows.
rule: Row Finder must include credible mid-tier tools and asymmetric pairings; every row must be mechanism-based and constraint-amplified.
tradeoff: Including less common tools may reduce immediate search volume in exchange for coverage and uniqueness.
failure_mode: Rows become repetitive, triage rejection rises, production slows, and category gaps persist.
structural_impact: Scaling depends on systematic tool-set expansion, not weakened triage or diluted comparisons.
